lines.text: My father was an engineer during the war... for the North. At first, he was for the South, but they were losing. And, ah, 'Never stick with a loser,' he always said. 'It's a matter of principle.'
It's a matter of principle. I don't operate on man who wears a gun.
You're lucky I came along here. I can fix that up for ya.
In San Antone, I used to work for a barber who was a surgeon on the side. I helped him operate on twelve or thirteen horses.
Wait a minute! Listen, I'm not a horse, understand!
And I'm not a doctor. So that makes us even.
Never enter into a deal for less than thirty percent.
You know, we got an old sayin' in Texas - God created all men equal... but the six gun made them different.
But I warn you... if you kill me while I'm lying here, I'll slit your throat.
Dead, huh? Well they say, 'Early to bed, early to rise, gets you shot between the eyes.'
New game... more fun than hopscotch. The first of these gentlemen that steps forward gets a new lead bullet between his eyes.
I don't enjoy being beaten when I ain't able to defend myself.
